hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on xx

We’ll be doing xx ex. meditation followed by time for reflection and sharing with each other.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

content.text: Our brains have developed to focus on the negative - threats, dangers, things that need fixing. That has helped humans survive for tens of thousands of years - but is not very helpful for feeling good or happy. In this exercise you’ll practice paying attention to the things we tend to take for granted, the things we are grateful for.

hostNotes.text:
Find a comfortable position. I will start the audio exercise and we'll meet back here afterwards. 

> Push play to start the audio exercise

Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

xxMain question

xxFurther explanations of main question if needed

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

content.text: How did you feel practicing gratitude?

hostNotes.text:
Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

content.text: How did you feel practicing gratitude?

hostNotes.text:
Well done. If you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

xx mission description

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text: Well done for practicing gratitude and counteracting some of the negativity bias nature has equipped us with. The next step is to share your gratitude letter with the person you wrote to. If you want to, read it out aloud to them.

en.name: PsyPal Scrambled exercise

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

en.description: Our minds are often set to focus on the negative. In this exercise we practice the opposite - expressing gratitude for some of the things in life we are grateful for. It can help us feel more fulfilled and happy, regardless of where we are in life.

cs.name: PsyPal Gratitude letters

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

cs.description: Our minds are often set to focus on the negative. In this exercise we practice the opposite - expressing gratitude for some of the things in life we are grateful for. It can help us feel more fulfilled and happy, regardless of where we are in life.

hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on xx

We’ll be doing xx ex. meditation followed by time for reflection and sharing with each other.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

content.text: Onze hersenen zijn zo gemaakt dat ze vooral letten op negatieve dingen: gevaren, bedreigingen, dingen die kapot zijn. Dat heeft mensen tienduizenden jaren geholpen om te overleven – maar het helpt niet echt om je goed of gelukkig te voelen. In deze oefening ga je oefenen met letten op de dingen die we normaal vinden, de dingen waar we dankbaar voor zijn.

hostNotes.text:
Find a comfortable position. I will start the audio exercise and we'll meet back here afterwards. 

> Push play to start the audio exercise

Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

xxMain question

xxFurther explanations of main question if needed

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

content.heading: Hoe voelde het om dankbaarheid te beoefenen?

hostNotes.text:
Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

content.heading: Hoe voelde het om dankbaarheid te beoefenen?

hostNotes.text:
Well done. If you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

xx mission description

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text:
Goed gedaan met het oefenen van dankbaarheid! Het is goed om te oefenen met het tegenovergestelde van alleen maar letten op negatieve dingen.

Als het kan, bedank dan ook echt de persoon aan wie je de bedankbrief hebt geschreven. We raden aan om met diegene af te spreken en je brief hardop voor te lezen.

nl.name: PsyPal Gratitude letters

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

nl.description: Onze gedachten zijn vaak gericht op negatieve dingen. In deze oefening doen we het tegenovergestelde: we zeggen waar we dankbaar voor zijn in ons leven. Dit kan ons helpen om meer tevreden en gelukkig te zijn, waar we ook zijn in ons leven.
